hints.content:
There are $\maroonD{4}$ rows of $\blueD{7}$ seals.

![Same image with the rows numbered 1  through 4 and the seals in the row numbered 1 through 7](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c08211cba078c2ba23154680ad22fdfc59bf335e)

options.explanation:
$\maroonD{4}\times\blueD{7}=\maroonD{4}\blueD{\text{ sevens}}$.

That's the same as $\maroonD{2}\blueD{\text{ sevens}}+\maroonD{2}\blueD{\text{ sevens}}$.

![The same image with a dividing line making 2 rows of 7 on the top, labeled 2 sevens, and 2 rows of 7 on the bottom labeled, 2 sevens](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/dfc18b466f4b3bfc28e43cd32cb6b47e1f0a1cb7)

There are $\redD{14}+\purpleC{14}=\greenD{28}$ total seals.

So $\maroonD{4}\times\blueD{7}=\greenD{28}$.

question.content:
**Multiply.**  
*Hint: Use the array below to help solve the equation.*   

$4 \times 7 = $ [[☃ numeric-input 1]]
